neurothresh: Neuroimaging Statistical Thresholding with LR-MFT

Source: R/neurothresh-package.R
neurothresh-package.Rd

Statistical thresholding for neuroimaging data using Likelihood-Ratio Matched-Filter Thresholding (LR-MFT) with hierarchical stepdown inference. Provides theoretically superior alternative to traditional GRF/RFT methods for detecting spatially extended activations. Includes baseline implementations (RFT, TFCE, cluster-FDR) for comparison.

Statistical thresholding for neuroimaging data using Likelihood-Ratio Matched-Filter Thresholding (LR-MFT) with hierarchical stepdown inference.

Main Functions

hier_scan

Main entry point for hierarchical LR-MFT analysis

score_set

Compute prior-weighted statistic T_kappa(R)

canonicalize_stat

Convert Z/t/neglog10p to Z-scores

Baseline Methods

rft_peak_fwer

RFT peak-level FWER

rft_cluster_fwer

RFT cluster-level FWER

tfce_transform

TFCE transformation

tfce_fwer

TFCE with permutation FWER

cluster_fdr

Topological cluster-FDR

Key Concepts

LR-MFT is provably more powerful than traditional GRF/RFT methods for detecting spatially extended activation blobs. It uses a prior-weighted soft evidence statistic:

$$T_\kappa(R) = \log \sum_{v \in R} \pi(v) \cdot \exp(\kappa \cdot Z(v))$$

where \(\pi(v)\) is the prior weight and \(\kappa\) is the temperature.
